content: In Greek mythology, who famously flew too close to the sun using wings made of feathers and wax?

I believe the figure you're referring to is Icarus. According to the myth, Icarus and his father Daedalus used wings made of feathers and wax to escape from Crete, but Icarus flew too close to the sun, causing the wax to melt and him to plummet into the sea.
